revision.comment: Rescued 1 archive link; reformat 6 links. [[User:GreenC/WaybackMedic_2.5|Wayback Medic 2.5]]
revision.text:
[[File:SolarGIS-Solar-map-Poland-en.png|thumb|[[insolation|Solar potential]] in [[Poland]]]]
'''Solar energy in Poland''' is a new sector of [[renewable energy]] and consists of [[solar thermal]] and [[solar electricity]]. Solar thermal, used for heating water was widely used in about {{convert|1700000|m2|ft2}} of [[solar thermal collector]] at the end of 2014. This corresponds to about 1,200 [[Megawatt|MW]]<sub>[[MWt|th]]</sub> capacity. Solar collectors are the second, after the biomass heating plants, source of "green heat" in Poland. In 2014, Poland was ranked fourth in sales of solar collector installations among European countries.<ref>[http://gramwzielone.pl/trendy/17118/polska-4-najwiekszym-rynkiem-kolektorow-slonecznych-w-europie-w-2014 Poland 4th biggest market of solar collectors in Europe in 2014]</ref>
The total [[solar photovoltaics]] (PV) power plants connected to the grid in Poland at the end of 2012 were about 1.29 MW<sub>[[MWp|p]]</sub> of capacity.<ref>[http://gramwzielone.pl/trendy/5310/rekordowy-rozwoj-energetyki-odnawialnej-w-polsce-w-2012-r Record development of renewable energy in Poland in 2012]</ref> According to Energy Regulatory Office photovoltaic power in Poland had 91.82 MW<sub>[[MWp|p]]</sub> installed capacity at the end of June 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.ure.gov.pl/pl/rynki-energii/energia-elektryczna/odnawialne-zrodla-ener/potencjal-krajowy-oze/5753,Moc-zainstalowana-MW.html |title=Installed capacity of electricity from renewables in Poland |access-date=2016-11-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171222052402/http://www.ure.gov.pl/pl/rynki-energii/energia-elektryczna/odnawialne-zrodla-ener/potencjal-krajowy-oze/5753,Moc-zainstalowana-MW.html |archive-date=2017-12-22 |url-status=dead }}</ref>

news|url=https://renewablesnow.com/news/polish-solar-capacity-reaches-13-gw-683863/|title=Polish Solar Capacity Reaches 13 GW|last=Tsanova|first=Tsvetomira|date=Jan 17, 2020|work=Renewables Now|access-date=Jan 29, 2020}}</ref> !2005 !2006 !2007 !2008 !2009 !2010 !2011 !2012 !2013 !2014 !2015 !2016 !2020 |- align="right" |0.3 |0.4 |0.6 |1 |1 |2 |1.8 |3.4 |4.2 |29.9 |110.9 |195.7* |1,299 |- | colspan="12" |* Estimated figure | |}
=== Notable installations === List of photovoltaic systems in Poland with a capacity above 20 kW:<ref>[http://gramwzielone.pl/energia-sloneczna/1056/lista-instalacji-fotowoltaicznych-w-polsce List of photovoltaic systems in Poland] dostęp: 31.01.2014.</ref><ref>[http://gramwzielone.pl/energia-sloneczna/13386/w-cieszanowie-na-podkarpaciu-powstaje-najwieksza-farma-fotowoltaiczna-w-polsce W Cieszanowie na Podkarpaciu powstaje największa farma fotowoltaiczna w Polsce]</ref><ref>[https://archive.today/20150131130048/http://gubin.naszemiasto.pl/artykul/gubin-1-najwieksza-w-polsce-elektrownia-sloneczna-zdjecia,2435323,artgal,t,id,tm.html Gubin 1 - największa w Polsce elektrownia słoneczna]</ref> * 2.0 MW [[Cieszanów]] (under construction, as of November 2014); * 1.84 MW [[Kolno]]; * 1.64 MW [[Gdańsk]]; * 1.5 MW [[Gubin, Poland|Gubin]]; * Photovoltaic farm in [[Wierzchosławice, Lesser Poland Voivodeship|Wierzchosławice]] - 1.0 MW; * 311 kW, [[Ruda Śląska]], [[Upper Silesia]] Waterworks; * 100 kW, [[Polkowice]], NG2; * 82 kW, [[Łódź]], [[Voivodeship]] Specialist Hospital; * 80.5 kW, [[Bydgoszcz]], Frost Company; * 71.76 kW, [[Jaworzno]], Shrine of Our Lady of Perpetual Help in [[Jaworzno]]; * 54 kW, [[Warsaw]], Center for Photovoltaics at the Faculty of Environmental Engineering, [[Warsaw University of Technology]]; * 40 kW, [[Bogumiłowice, Lesser Poland Voivodeship|Bogumiłowice]];<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.schueco.com/solar/public/plant/show/307127?lang=en |title=Archived copy |access-date=2014-09-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304033831/http://www.schueco.com/solar/public/plant/show/307127?lang=en |archive-date=2016-03-04 |url-status=dead }}</ref> * 21.42 kW, [[Rybnik]]; * 20 kW, [[Rzeszów]], School of Law and Administration; * 20 kW, [[Warsaw]], Embassy of Japan.
Online real production of 2 kW PV plant in Poland.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://2kw.krdglobalgroup.com/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=2019-05-26 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170914205824/http://2kw.krdglobalgroup.com/ |archive-date=2017-09-14 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
The [[Green Institute Foundation]] supports the development of solar energy in Poland running a campaign "Energy Democracy".<ref>[http://www.demokracjaenergetyczna.pl Energy Democracy]</ref>
